text: to see a plan on paper and then to walk
in here and to see this memorial look
exactly as we were promised it was going
to look it gives me a real sense of
comfort gives me a sense of
accomplishment it makes me feel very
proud people today tomorrow into the
future will have a memorial where they
can come and learn all about who my
brother was and those other 39 brave
heroes it's been a a an emotional 14
years so much of has gone into this that
looking back I'm actually amazed that we
are where we are the family's first
concern when this memorial is being
developed was that the sacred ground be
protected when we first came here and
our first opportunity as families to
look over the the crash site it was a
very raw violent emotional reaction it's
still is raw but I I didn't find peace
now when I come back the memorial I I'm
much more at peace I like to go down to
the wall to overlook the sacred ground
even to walk out on this sacred ground
and think about my brother
I think about his life his kids when we
were kids and then I think about those
final 20 minutes of his life and I think
what must have taken to be a crew member
or a passenger on that flight you know
they weren't 40 here I was walking on
that plane that morning they were 40
individuals and and their heroism was
revealed through their actions that day
Oh
